channel.title: hr_nuke (CSGO) models and textures giving bad reflections
channel.description:
[b]So, I tried getting some hr_nuke (new de_nuke remake = hr_nuke) props and textures into Black Mesa. Why? Because they're awesome![/size][/b]
But, here are the issues:[/size] [img]https://i.imgur.com/sxTDLJG.png[/img]
I think that image sumarizes it pretty well - reflections give purple-black checkers and I can't figure out why. Checking VMTs and all seems fine. My friend imported same stuff in Portal 2 an worked right out of the box.
Now, I actually got hr_nuke's pipes to work:[/size] [img]https://i.imgur.com/g8hYrMc.png[/img] [b]As you can see - no bad reflections. I believe the only thing I did was lower $envmapsaturation and $envmaptint values. But that doesn't seem to work for anything else.
[/b] [b]Aside from pipes, all foliage props work too.[/b][/size]

item.title: hr_nuke (CSGO) models and textures giving bad reflections
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
CS:GO implemented a bunch of new cubemap features, and they also use a higher .mdl version number than ours. It’s highly likely that most CS:GO props will not work with our engine, unless decompiled/recompiled. Even then, it’s not likely. We had to do the same for Portal 2 props.

Read full topic
item.source: hr_nuke (CSGO) models and textures giving bad reflections

item.title: hr_nuke (CSGO) models and textures giving bad reflections
item.dc:creator: Snaiper
item.description:
So, I tried getting some hr_nuke (new de_nuke remake = hr_nuke) props and textures into Black Mesa. Why? Because they’re awesome![/size]

But, here are the issues:[/size]

813×471

I think that image sumarizes it pretty well - reflections give purple-black checkers and I can’t figure out why. Checking VMTs and all seems fine. My friend imported same stuff in Portal 2 an worked right out of the box.

Now, I actually got hr_nuke’s pipes to work:[/size]

813×471

[b]As you can see - no bad reflections. I believe the only thing I did was lower $envmapsaturation and $envmaptint values. But that doesn’t seem to work for anything else.

[/b]
Aside from pipes, all foliage props work too.[/size]
